name: Myc
otheraliases: Dmel_CG10798, CG10798, D-Myc, DM, DMYc, Diminutive, Dm, Dmel\CG10798, Dmyc, EG:BACN5I9.1, MYC, anon-WO03040301.171, bHLHe57, c-MYC, c-Myc, c-myc, cMyc, d-myc, dMYC, dMyc, dMyc1, dm, dm/dMyc, dm/myc, dmyc, dmyc1, l(1)G0139, l(1)G0354, l(1)G0359, myc
summary: Enables DNA binding activity; DNA-binding transcription factor activity; and ubiquitin-specific protease binding activity. Involved in several processes, including DNA endoreduplication; positive regulation of developmental growth; and positive regulation of macromolecule biosynthetic process. Located in nucleolus. Part of protein-containing complex. Colocalizes with histone locus body. Is expressed in several structures, including anlage in statu nascendi; cuboidal/columnar epithelium; embryonic/larval midgut primordium; germline cell; and gut section. Used to study brain cancer and cancer. Human ortholog(s) of this gene implicated in several diseases, including angiosarcoma; carcinoma (multiple); demyelinating disease; hematologic cancer (multiple); and prostate cancer (multiple). Orthologous to human MYC (MYC proto-oncogene, bHLH transcription factor). [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2025]
